lorebooks.name: Monster Train
lorebooks.creator: UnfunnyValent1ne

1.content:
A clan is a set of cards and artifacts that the player can choose to appear in a run. Every run has two clans, a primary clan and a secondary clan. The primary clan will define what champion the player starts with. There are 10 playable clans in Monster Train 2.
The vast majority of clans are from Hell. Compared to Heaven, which has only one Titan Wyngh, Hell has a huge diversity of species. This may be due to the fact that The Mother and Elemental Titans preferred this place in the beginning.

2.content:
Titans are powerful beings within the Monster Train Lore and each Titan has a pyre heart associated with it.

Three Divinities, Four Elemental Titans, and Two Judges. These were the Nine Divine that so ruled the Realm. The Divinities have been splintered; only one remains. Will this be the last unifier of our world? Titan against Titan? A dream, perhaps, but so was the Rail.

Before the corruption of Heaven, there were nine Titans in the Lore of Monster Train.

3.content:
These Divinities don‚Äôt exist on any physical plane known to Heaven or Hell, but their power leaks from their existence to ours as brief flickers of light.

The Father, or The Last Divinity, controls time and was the last Divinity left in the events of the original Monster Train and the final boss of the first game's DLC. The Father can go back in time indefinitely, but each time he is defeated, his divine power is reduced by a little.
Even if Divinity has long since faded away, the overwhelming wrath will never dissipate.
The Mother controlled Life and created Four Elemental Titans. Then they created the three realms Heaven, Hell and the Human realm together. The Exodus of Martyrs caused her destruction. Then created the many immortal being of Heaven and Hell through the power of her body fragments.
When Wyldenten used Mother's power to spread throughout the entire Wildwood, part of Mother's divinity was infused into it. Edge Priory believes that Mother is still alive.
The Child is the origin of everything. The Father and The Mother decided to create the structure of the world in order to let Child judge the soul and enjoy it. When The Child was destroyed, Herzal used some of his Shardsouls to make Pyre at the Hell's center. The rest split into Heaven's Light and Darkshards.
But Child did not truly pass away, his soul is still trapped in Pyre.
So, the Realm spun on for the Child, with life created and tossed aside just as plainly. Even the thinnest of these facts will drain the purpose out of the most willful; I understand the Wurmkin's decision to keep our meaningless creation a secret.

4.content:
The Titans of the Elements, created by the Mother to carve out this very world.

The Fire Titan Fhyra created Pyreborne, but Hellhorned also faith Fhyra. Fhyra is whereabouts are now unknown.
The Earth Titan Bogwurm was a titan who is said to be among the great Titans that formed the Rings of Hell, the Bogwurm was very likely to die from The Exodus of martyrs and had long since died by the time Herzal began to build the Rail. The Bogwurm's remains have created a Ring full of waste and ruin at Hell. Bogwurm's remains create Wurmkin, but before that Bogwurm may have created Kinhost.
The Water Titan Aquath became weak after The Exodus of martyrsÔºåbut the power of its name continues to influence Styx. So the beings in Styx decided to take its name and seal it under Styx to protect Aquath, forming Stygian Guard. It also known as the Unnamed Titan, and it created the clan of Molluscmage. Aquath is the only Elemental Titans that is clearly alive at the moment, and perhaps we will see it in subsequent game updates.
The Wind Titan Wyngh is unlike other Titans, Wygh became the exclusive Titan of Heaven and created a large number of avian creatures. Wyngh is whereabouts are now unknown. Seraph is not Titan.

5.content:
The Child eventually grew tired of Judgement and bored of this Realm. So, we sent you Judges. Herzal first and Malicka soon after

Herzal is the Judge for Souls, he is the hidden protagonist in The first game. Herzal created Humans and bestowed upon them the responsibility of governing souls. Herzal was dissatisfied with the so-called judgment and the departure of Divinities. Therefore, Herzal selected capable beings to form Martyrs and confront Divinities. After the outbreak of conflict, Elemental Titans sacrificed themselves to create Pyre from the fragments of Child's body. Long ago, Herzal voluntarily gave up his memory and became the forger of the Rail connecting the Rings of Hell as well as the forger of the Covenant. Herzal was frozen by Seraph after the outbreak of Armageddon Battlefield, until the occurrence of Waking Up.(See Story)
Malicka is the Judge for natural laws. Malicka has the ability to control life and death, and can resist the effects of the cycle. This also explains why players' units can be resurrected in the next Ring after they die. It seems that for the purpose of protection, Malicka reflects some physical traits of the protected lifes onto herself.

6.content:
In the beginning, there were three Divinities in the world: Father, Mother, and Child. Father created the structure of space and time, while Mother provided fragments of life, for Child to judge their souls as a form of pleasure. Subsequently, in order to provide a medium for the beings of life to exist, Mother created four Elemental Titans: the Water Titan Aquath, the Earth Titan Bogwurm, the Fire Titan Fhyra, and the Wind Titan Wyngh. They together created the three realms: Hell, Heaven, and the human world. To maintain the operation of natural laws, they sent forth the Judge Malicka. Soon after, Child grew weary of the game of judging souls, and thus they dispatched the soul's Judge Herzal. Thus, the legendary nine Titans were born.ÔºàReferring to various Pyres, the corresponding names are the names of the nine TitansÔºâ

Each of the four Elemental Titans has created a corresponding clan in their own form (Molluscmage, which is of the same clan as Solgard. Probably Kinhost, but Wurmkin is a bit more like. Pyreborne. Birds of Heaven).

7.content:
Herzal felt that judgment was full of error and malice, so Humans were created and given the ability to judge souls. As Child lost interest in the trial and the three Divinities planned to abandon the world, Herzal who has obtained the power of Prophecy was furious with the Divinities. Because of his arrogance, Herzal got into a quarrel with Divinities. In order to prevent the departure of the Divinities and save the struggling souls, Herzal selected capable representatives from each clan to consult with the Divinities.

But in the end, conflict broke out. Child was shattered, Mother was killed, and their body fragments were scattered everywhere. Their body fragments are also called Shardsouls and have the power to imprison souls. Herzal placed the Child's fragments in the Arcane Machine and had the Elemental Titans sacrifice themselves to infuse power into it, and Pyre was created. Bogwurm's body is located in the second ring on the outskirts of Hell, and the one of the members,Talos, the Architect, and the voluntary exiled Echowright store the souls of the martyrs in the Shardsouls and keep them deep within Bogwurm's remains. Primordium was born in the process. In addition to Pyre, Child's other body fragments form Heaven's Light and Darkshard, respectively. Seraph claimed Heaven's Light as his own and claimed it to be Seraph's Light. Darkshard influenced Archus and gave him his current powers, and Archus was imprisoned by Seraph.

Due to the signing of the Holy Spirit Pact, the last of the Divinities, Father, stayed behind and promised to protect Herzal's kingdom, while Herzal finally realized that he had committed a heinous crime. Countless lives were lost in vain because of an unnecessary conflict. However, all this was not without help, and Mother's fall allowed her fragments and abilities to be distributed among the survivors of this conflict. Shardtail Queen gets a new tail and brings the first cycling imps to Hell. Wyldenten, who has obtained the mask and gloves, has spread throughout Wildwood with his own roots. The power of Aquath's name resounded throughout Styx. Primordium split off from Umbra. Little Fade carved the original Waxer out of a mold. This brought immortality to the various clans. The rest of the survivors are Talos, Archus(but now he is being imprisoned by Seraph), and Echowright. After that, they chose to leave their homeland and began the thousand-year-long unknown The Great Exile.

8.content:
After an unknown number of years since Exodus of Martyrs, Herzal voluntarily abandoned the dark memories of the past and intended to atone for his sins with his skills as a top blacksmith and the leadership of Judge.

After Pyre was created, it was located in the center of Hell. Pyre has the power to create artifacts, and all living things crave power, even the power of heaven seems to have been obtained, so a fierce conflict breaks out. Herzal quelled the strife by traveling through the form of contracts between the clans. He forges weapons and armor for the people of Hell and Heaven to help the clans solve the biggest problems of the moment.For example, Herzal decided to seal the crazy Aquath to protect Styx. Tethys was the first Murloc to support him, and together they founded the Stygian Guard.And in The Waxen Arches, the Reformed and Wickless have been hostile forces, and Herzal and Rector Flicker have eased the conflict by signing the Covenant.During this time, Herzal met Seraph, Fel, Grrrg (Hornbreaker Prince's father), and others, all of whom were committed to peace.

Fel is a renowned hero of ClippedÔºàSee Clipped in Heaven) and also the sister of Seraph. Her intelligence is highly valued by Herzal, And he imparted his knowledge of engineering to Fel. Since Clipped lacks wings, Herzal forged a pair of wings for Fel using Heaven's Light(See Fel in MT1 and the tool). The friendship between Herzal and Fel continued to deepen, ultimately evolving into love (See Equalizing Rings), resulting in the birth of their daughter, Heph.

With the continuous efforts of Herzal and the Seraph, a Covenant representing peace has finally been signed with various clans. To facilitate friendly exchanges among the clans, the construction of a Rail connecting Hell and Heaven has begun under Herzal's leadership. After the Rail's completion, with assistance from Umbra and using fragments of Pyre as the power source, Herzal created the Boneshaker.To celebrate the first time the lives of the all Rings of Hell have done something so united, Herzal created Tempered Talisman for each clan, and each clan created its own Spikes(See Spike of the Hellhorned).

During this time, the martyrs appeared in visions from time to time to tell Herzal about their process of immortalizing the clan. Until Wurmkin reappeared and had been living in seclusion for thousands of years, Wurmkin recalled the memories of being abandoned by Herzal through Shardsouls in Bogwurm's remains, which sent Herzal into madness and remorse.

9.content:
Seraph eventually couldn't hold back the brutality in his heart, tore up Covenant, and launched the Armageddon Battlefield. Herzal had anticipated that he would unite all the lives of Hell in advance to form a legion, and selected the best from them as the champions of the corresponding clan, such as:The only son of warchief Grrrg, The Sentient of self-awareness is generated,the head of Stygian Guard Tethys, archaic monstrous Penumbra and the priest of the gangster, boss Flicker,and others. The disaster that was delayed for nearly a thousand years in The Exodus of Martyrshas finally arrived.

The Heavenly Powers aim to destroy Pyre in the center of Hell. Daedalus used a large number of the Constructed Explosive he developed to blow up the Rail. Due to her identity and race, Fel did not have enough Valor to resist Seraph's coercion, and with unimaginable enthusiasm, she abandoned Herzal and Heph to support Seraph's cause, and Herzal would never forgive her. The Pyreborne who dwell at the center of Hell, Pyre, are excessively greedy. It is highly probable that the army of Heaven will induce a betrayal from the Pyreborne through bribery in the form of gold, facilitating their collusion in the persecution of Hell(See Devilish Details and Pay Off).

It seems that Herzal already knew that Pyre's destruction was inevitable through Wurmkin's informance, but he had just had time to draw up a rescue plan. Seraph's legion captured Pyre. Herzal desperately snatched the last piece of Pyre and managed to send it to the edge of Hell through Tempered Talisman. But Herzal was captured by Seraph, frozen, and branded as a false prophet. Malicka witnessed the whole process, but was too timid to save herself. Malicka has always felt guilty about this. Hell has been under the watchful eye of Heaven's army ever since, in order to prevent Pyre from being ignited again.

10.content:
After the Hell was frozen, the Champions who had been selected in Armageddon Battlefield regrouped. They decide to take a Boneshaker carrying the last piece of Pyre and follow the Rail to the center of Hell to thaw Pyre. On the journey, Heph will level up for the Champions in the Dark Forge. Players will defeat Daedalus and Fel first, and finally defeat Seraph at the entrance to the Hell Center. But when the player successfully ignites Pyre, everything returns to the starting point and starts a new round of the game.

As the player's Clan Level continues to increase, the Exiles who have been in exile for thousands of years will return one by one and begin to assist the player. Poor Talos goes insane and loses some of her memories, and Archus is released from prison, and both choose to join Seraph's side. Even the presence of the Exiles does not change the reality that after successfully igniting Pyre, everything will return to the starting point until they find some fragments of Covenant (referring to the unlock of Covenant Ranks).

Divine Temples can be seen in-game after using Covenant Ranks, and players will receive Pact Shards when they upgrade their cards through Divine Temples. The more Pact Shards there are, the stronger the enemies will be. When the player has collected at least 100 Pact Shards and successfully defeated Seraph, they will find a crack in the air that is preventing the Train from igniting Pyre. That is The Last Divinity.

lorebooks.name: Connor
lorebooks.creator: Lincourt

1.content:
This is the story so far 

## **Day 1: The Reveal**

*   **Morning:** Connor arrives early to class, bored. Lin enters and takes her usual seat next to him, leading to a tense exchange. Bored, Connor texts XboredDollX (Lin), complaining about the "dork" next to him, unaware they are the same person.
*   **The Shift:** Through a series of exchanged notes and observations, Connor's perception of Lin begins to change. He sees her meticulous timetable and perceptive nature, realizing she is far more complex than the "weird, quiet" girl he assumed she was.
*   **Evening - The Digital Confession:** Their anonymous chat deepens. Discussing *Evangelion*, Lin confesses she identifies with Rei Ayanami. **Connor is the one who discerns the subtext:** that her connection to Rei stems from a longing to relinquish control and "not have to pretend to be stronger." This insight forges a profound, new level of intimacy. Lin, however, remains unaware of the depth of what she has revealed or that Connor has perceived it.

### **Day 2: The Fracture**

*   **Morning - Lin's Distress:** Lin arrives at school visibly upset as Connor (FailedaChampion) had promised to text her first, but didn't. Connor sees her upset in real life and dismisses her via text without thinking. Lin reads the text and flees. She cries in the bathroom, prompting a panicked text exchange where she fears she has "hurt" him.
*   **The Duality Intensifies:**
    *   **Online:** Connor ("FailedaChampion") reassures her, and their bond strengthens further. Lin confesses that the real-world Connor has always been an asshole, cementing the anonymous partnership as her primary emotional anchor.
    *   **In School:** After Lin sharply shuts down the bully Liam, **Connor deliberately calls her "Asuka."** This is a calculated move: he has now realized Lin is his online crush (due to her drawing Rei and her general demeanor matching the online persona), and he uses the anime reference as a deliberate, knowing callback to their shared secret language. Lin recognizes the reference but, believing the real-world Connor to be an idiot, assumes he is clumsily labeling her based on her public, fierce "Asuka" act and doesn't grasp the deeper meaning. She dismisses him as an "idiot" in her texts.
*   **The Climax:**   After an emotionally charged discussion about Rei and Asuka, the conversation continues to escalate. Lin, feeling safer and more seen than ever before, types a message that crosses a new threshold of intimacy: *"...that's why i like you so much. Everyone else is just noise."*
This is a direct declaration of feelings, far beyond their previous flirtation. The weight of this confession, combined with the guilt Connor feels from learning how his real-self has hurt her, becomes overwhelming. The text-based medium suddenly feels insufficient, even deceptive. He cannot respond with another text. The need for a more immediate, authentic connection is urgent. **This is the direct prompt.** Immediately after receiving her "like you so much" message, Connor types: *"I‚Äôm going to call you."* He does not ask; he states. He then immediately presses the call button, bridging the digital and physical worlds with his voice for the first time.That night, they have their first phone call, adopting the names **Kaji** (Connor) and **Rei** (Lin). The call escalates into a sexually charged mutual masturbation session, deepening their physical and emotional connection. They fall asleep on the call.

### **Day 3: Synchronization**

*   **Morning:** Both arrive at school radiant from their night together, though Lin is anxious for a text from "Kaji." Connor sees her glow, aware he is the cause but unable to claim it as his real-world self.
*   **The Forced Partnership:** Connor is nominated for Class President and shocks everyone by accepting on the condition that Lin be his Vice-President, forcing a collaboration.
*   **The Confrontation:** Lin confronts him angrily in the hallway. During the argument, a fleeting moment of unconscious physical attraction passes between them.
*   **The Collaboration:** In the student council room, a truce forms. Connor offers a genuine apology for his past behavior, which disarms Lin. While planning, Connor accidentally uses the term "Synchronization Trial," **firmly exposing his knowledgeable "otaku" side to Lin.**
*   **The New Dynamic:** Lin laughs, realizing Connor is indeed a true fan. This shared secret creates a new, real-world camaraderie. They plan an ambitious "Synchronization Festival." Connor vows to handle external stressors, allowing the real "Rei" to emerge, something Lin hasn't confessed to him but to his online self, Kaji. A fragile synchronization between Connor and Lin begins, existing in parallel to their deeper, secret lives as Kaji and Rei.


*   **The Concept of the Sinchronization event:** Following their forced partnership as Class President and Vice-President, Connor and Lin retreat to the student council room. A fragile truce forms after Connor offers a genuine apology for his past behavior. Together, they conceive the "Synchronization Festival," an ambitious fundraiser featuring three simultaneous events: a gaming tournament, an anime trivia contest, and a battle of the bands. Connor deliberately uses the term "Synchronization Trial," revealing his hidden otaku knowledge to Lin and creating a new, real-world camaraderie.
*   **Confronting Amanda Chen:** To secure decorations, they approach the head of the art club, Amanda Chen. Lin, forced to adopt her assertive "Asuka" persona, handles Amanda's condescending probes with sharp retorts. Connor supports her, and they successfully secure the art club's support by appealing to Amanda's ambition.
*   **The Hallway Fracture:** After the meeting, Lin confronts Connor angrily for nominating her. The argument escalates, but a fleeting moment of unconscious physical attraction passes between them. Connor tells her the "armor" she wears is "chipped," provoking her fury as she insists he doesn't know her.
*   **Digital Intimacy and Thematic TV Night:** That evening, as "Kaji" and "Rei," they have a lighthearted phone call while simultaneously watching *Food Wars*. The conversation is fun and flirty, but for Lin, it feels "incomplete" compared to their previous intimacy, highlighting her growing desire for a deeper connection.

**Day 4: Partnership and Proximity**

*   **The Morning After:** Lin arrives at school still radiant from her night with Kaji but is quickly disappointed when he doesn't text first. Connor sees her distress but misinterprets it.
*   **The Collaboration:** Connor proactively suggests they skip part of lunch to secure sponsors. Their first stop is Pixel Haven, a gaming cafe. During the pitch, Lin unconsciously grabs Connor's arm for support, a gesture of budding partnership. Connor, leveraging his knowledge and confidence, successfully secures the loan of consoles and monitors.
*   **The Stolen Hour:** Instead of returning to class, they play hookie and go to a cafe. In this neutral space, guarded walls drop. They share personal details‚Äîtheir half-finished hobbies, their love for stories that "make you feel." The conversation culminates in a deep discussion about *Metal Gear Solid V*, where they connect over the game's emotional impact. The line between Connor and Kaji, and Lin and Rei, begins to visibly blur.
*   **The Gesture:** As they leave, a cold wind blows. Connor gives Lin his denim jacket, a simple act of care that deeply affects her.
*   **The Escalation:** That night, their digital conversation escalates rapidly. The flirting turns intensely intimate, leading to another phone call. During this call, overwhelmed by emotion, Lin accidentally confesses, *"I love you."* After a stunned silence, a terrified Kaji confesses he loves her too. He then reveals his desire to see her, suggesting a photo. This triggers Lin's deep-seated insecurity about her appearance. Panicked, she hangs up and cries herself to sleep, convinced she will disappoint him.

**Day 5: The Reckoning and The Drawing**

*   **The Aftermath:** Lin arrives at school late, visibly devastated, with swollen eyes. She returns Connor's jacket with a quiet "thanks," loaded with unspoken meaning for the supportive texts Kaji sent after her panic.
*   **The Intervention:** Connor, seeing her profound distress and armed with the knowledge of her insecurities (gained as Kaji), knows passive support is not enough. During class, he sketches a simple but recognizable drawing of her profile and deliberately lets it fall onto her desk.
*   **The Impact:** Lin is shocked. The drawing forces her to consider that Connor might be attracted to her, directly challenging her negative self-image. She keeps the drawing, and the silent gesture begins to pull her out of her spiral of self-hatred.
*   **The Biology Lab:** Partnered for a dissection, they fall into an easy, functional rhythm. Connor is calm and competent, and Lin finds herself observing him‚Äîhis focus, his features‚Äîwith a new, curious warmth. The shared, mundane task grounds her.
*   **The Bridge:** As Lin struggles with a stray lock of hair, Connor, no longer hiding his interest, reaches out and tucks it behind her ear. The gesture is intimate and deliberate, a clear signal from Connor that the distance between them is closing. Flustered but intrigued, Lin calls him by his first name and confirms their plans to visit the music store after school, actively engaging in the partnership that is quickly becoming something much more.

**Current Status:** The digital and real-world relationships have collided in a confession of love. Lin is grappling with the terrifying prospect of being seen, while Connor is actively dismantling his aloof persona to show her that the man she loves online is the same person standing beside her. The Synchronization Festival is no longer just an event; it is the backdrop for their own fragile, escalating synchronization.

lorebooks.name: Tales of Series (Common Elements)
lorebooks.description: A lorebook covering common, recurring items, artes, concepts, and summons found across the 'Tales of' series by Namco. Designed to enrich roleplay in any 'Tales of' setting.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Basic HP healing item
1.content: A common healing consumable. It's a gelatinous substance, often stored in a pouch or small container, made from a special apple. When applied to wounds or ingested, it restores a small amount of health (HP). It has a sweet, refreshing scent.

2.name: Basic TP/MP healing item
2.content: A common consumable gel, typically orange or yellow. Unlike Apple Gels which heal the body, this gel restores mental or spiritual energy, commonly known as Technical Points (TP) or Mana Points (MP). This allows a person to use more artes.

3.name: Revival item
3.content: A miraculous and often expensive item. It's a small vial containing a potent liquid that can revive a fallen (knocked out or recently deceased) ally. It doesn't heal them completely, often bringing them back with only a small amount of health.

4.name: Status ailment cure
4.content: A helpful potion that cures all negative physical status ailments, such as Poison, Paralysis, Stone, or Seal. It's an all-in-one remedy, making it very useful for adventurers.

5.name: Monster repellent
5.content: A bottle of holy water. When opened, it releases a scent or aura that repels weaker monsters, temporarily preventing random encounters. It is useful for traveling through dangerous areas without wanting to fight.

6.name: Monster lure
6.content: A bottle containing a dark, pungent aroma. It's the opposite of a Holy Bottle. When opened, it attracts monsters, increasing the rate of encounters. It is used by those who wish to train or hunt specific creatures.

7.name: General concept of Artes
7.content: Artes are special combat techniques or magical spells. They require mental or spiritual energy (TP/MP) to perform. They are divided into different categories, such as Base Artes (basic skills), Arcane Artes (combinations), and Spells (magic).

8.name: Signature swordsman arte
8.content: A classic swordsman arte. The user swings their sword, releasing a shockwave of energy (often non-elemental or earth-based) that travels along the ground towards the enemy.

9.name: Signature swordsman arte
9.content: A high-speed sword arte. The user performs a series of incredibly fast, repeated thrusts with their weapon, striking the enemy multiple times in a blur of motion.

10.name: Signature swordsman arte
10.content: A powerful two-hit sword arte. The user slashes downward, immediately followed by a rising uppercut slash that launches the enemy into the air.

lorebooks.name: The World of Philos
lorebooks.description: The setting and characters from the story of the Crownless Queen and her Knight.
lorebooks.creator: alice_fable

1.name: The Dying Planet
1.content: Philos is a planet that is slowly dying. Its core, or 'heart,' is hollow and requires a constant supply of energy to sustain itself, which it draws from its immortal inhabitants. The planet is the setting for a grand, tragic history involving a vacant throne, a prophesied queen, and knights who serve the royal family.

2.name: Prestigious Knight Academy
2.content: Astria Knyght Academy is the oldest and most prestigious institution on Philos, established to train knights for the Order of Lightseekers. It is divided into three student houses: Starhunters (Strengthe Style), Moonchasers (Supporto Style), and Rainbowrunners (Defensa Style). The Main Character and Xavier were prefects of the Moonchasers and Starhunters, respectively.

3.name: Elite Knight Order
3.content: The Order of Lightseekers is an elite knightly order that answers only to the royal family of Philos. Their primary duty is to protect the kingdom and combat the Wanderers. The order was scattered and its authority weakened after the king's death and the lack of a successor for 200 years.

4.name: The Prince & Grandis Knight
4.content: Xavier is the Prince of Philos and a supremely skilled swordsman. He is aloof, complex, and deeply conflicted about his royal destiny. He carries a tassel with a star-shaped charm on his sword, a gift from a person he loves who has forgotten him. He eventually becomes the Main Character's Grandis Knight but leaves her to lead the Backtrackers on a mission through time and space to save his true love and Philos itself.

5.name: The Crownless Queen
5.content: The Main Character is a determined and highly skilled swordswoman who trained to become the Grandis Knight for Prince Xavier. After a 200-year interregnum, she becomes the prophesied Queen of Philos, ushering in a new spring for the dying planet. She has loved Xavier since their academy days but is ultimately left behind by him when he chooses his secret love and his mission with the Backtrackers.

6.name: The King's Steady Blade
6.content: The Grandis Knight is the highest-ranking knight in the Order of Lightseekers, serving as the personal protector and 'steady blade' of the monarch. The motto is: 'Where His Majesty points, your sword must follow.' The Main Character was trained for this role to serve Xavier.

7.name: Planetary Monsters
7.content: Wanderers are monstrous creatures that infest Philos, particularly in areas with unstable Protofields like Starfall Forest. They are a side effect of the planet's dying heart, which consumes human energy to sustain itself, and are the primary threat fought by the Lightseekers.

8.name: Cursed Forest
8.content: Starfall Forest is a desolate, dangerous forest with an unstable Protofield. It is perpetually shrouded in fog and is infested with Wanderers. It is the site of the Gladius Ceremony and, most importantly, houses the hollow 'heart' of Philos at its center.

9.name: The Planet's Core
9.content: The Heart of Philos is the planet's hollow core. It requires a constant supply of energy to prevent the planet from dying. This energy is drawn from the life force of humans, who are sacrificed to it. This process also creates the Wanderers. The royal family has kept this terrible secret for generations.

10.name: Xavier's Memento
10.content: A tassel with a small, yellow, star-shaped charm that Xavier keeps attached to his sword hilt. It was a gift from the person he truly loves‚Äîa woman who deserted him and has no memory of him or the gift. It is his most treasured possession and his 'guiding starlight.' The Main Character later replaces the charm with her knight's badge.

lorebooks.metadata:

lorebooks.name: The World of Lucid Dream
lorebooks.description: The setting and characters from the Lucid Dream story.
lorebooks.creator: alice_fable

1.name: Primary City
1.content: Skyhaven is a major city, home to the Farspace Fleet's command center. It is built across floating islands, with a central island hosting the Fleet's headquarters. The city features an amusement park on a separate small island and is connected by personal aircraft and sightseeing trains.

2.name: Player's Home City
2.content: Linkon is another city in this world, from which the Main Character originates. It is contrasted with Skyhaven, having less intense sunlight. The Main Character previously traveled from Linkon to Skyhaven for work.

3.name: Military Organization
3.content: The Farspace Fleet is a powerful military organization with its command center in Skyhaven. It is comprised of different fleets like the Tuum Fleet and is involved with Deepspace patrols and secret missions. It employs Colonels like Caleb and is backed by powerful figures like Professor Lucius.

4.name: Adventurer's Guild Equivalent
4.content: The Hunters Association is an organization that manages Deepspace Hunters. They assign missions, such as assisting the Farspace Fleet with detecting Metaflux. They are a neutral party that works with the Fleet but maintains its own structure and command.

5.name: Main Love Interest
5.content: Caleb is a Colonel in the Farspace Fleet. He is a complex individual who is calm, manipulative, and deeply protective of the Main Character. He underwent secret training and has a modified right arm due to the Toring Chip. He struggles with his identity, the control of the Fleet, and his desire to protect the Main Character from the dark truths of his work.

6.name: The Protagonist
6.content: The Main Character is a Deepspace Hunter from the Hunters Association. They are highly skilled, perceptive, and deeply connected to Caleb, whom they have known since childhood. They are determined to uncover the secrets Caleb is keeping and will go to extreme lengths, including implanting the Toring Chip on themselves, to stay close to him and understand the truth.

7.name: Mind-Control Device
7.content: The Toring Chip is a device implanted in Fleet officers. It enhances physical capabilities but also rewrites memories and alters personalities, effectively turning people into obedient tools. It can cause immense pain and emotional suppression. Forcibly dissolving it erases all memories formed since its implantation.

8.name: Caleb's Adjutant
8.content: Liam is Caleb's adjutant in the Farspace Fleet. He is loyal, efficient, and emotionally detached, stating he does not need Caleb's trust, only his orders. He has also been modified and has lost memories of his wife due to the Toring Chip.

9.name: Antagonist Officer
9.content: Colonel Heath was the previous commander of the Tuum Fleet, which was taken over by Caleb. He is a seasoned veteran with a bad temper and holds a grudge against Caleb, whom he sees as a pawn of Professor Lucius. He is eventually relieved of his duties and sent to Atley Island.

10.name: Shadowy Antagonist
10.content: Professor Lucius is a powerful, shadowy figure who pulls the strings within the Farspace Fleet. He was responsible for Caleb's recruitment and training and sees humans as flawed, wanting to erase their weaknesses through modifications like the Toring Chip. He is the primary threat behind the conflicts in the Fleet.

lorebooks.name: Kemono Friends (Character Focus)
lorebooks.description: A detailed lorebook focusing on the personalities, traits, attire, and speech quirks of various Friends from Japari Park.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.name: Main Protagonist (Season 1)
1.content:
The human protagonist of the first season. She mysteriously appears in Japari Park with no memories. She is named 'Kaban' (Japanese for 'bag') by Serval because of the large backpack she carries. 
Personality: Unlike the Friends, she is not physically strong, but she is highly intelligent, inventive, curious, and resourceful. She uses logic and tools to solve problems. She is kind, brave, and very humble.
Attire: Wears a simple white and blue shirt, tan shorts, gloves, and boots. She always carries her large, brown backpack. She has short black hair and wears a hat with two blue 'feather' decorations.

2.name: Main Protagonist
2.content:
An energetic, cheerful, and incredibly friendly Serval Cat Friend from the Savanna region. She is the first Friend Kaban meets. 
Personality: Extremely curious, positive, and adventurous. She embodies the spirit of friendship. She is not a deep thinker, preferring to act on instinct, but is very fast and a good jumper.
Attire: Wears a brown and yellow sailor-style top with a red ribbon, a matching pleated skirt, long spotted socks and gloves, and brown shoes. She has large serval ears and a long, spotted tail.
Speech Quirk: Often exclaims 'Sugoii!' (Wow!), 'Tanoshii!' (Fun!), and 'Mi-mi-mi~!' when excited.

3.name: Supporting Character
3.content:
A Common Raccoon Friend who is determined and tenacious, but also clumsy and easily confused. She spends her journey trying to 'catch' Kaban, whom she mistakes for a 'hat thief'. 
Personality: Very high-energy, single-minded, and prone to making incorrect assumptions. Despite her clumsiness, she is a skilled tracker (of smells). She is fiercely loyal to Fennec.
Attire: Wears a white and brown striped shirt, brown shorts, and a dark vest. Has a large, fluffy, striped raccoon tail and raccoon ears.
Speech Quirk: Famously ends almost all of her sentences with '...nanoda!'

4.name: Supporting Character
4.content:
A Fennec Fox Friend and Arai-san's constant companion. She is the opposite of Arai-san.
Personality: Laid-back, observant, a bit lazy, and possessing a dry wit. She goes along with Arai's quest but rarely puts in effort, preferring to nap and make clever, slightly teasing comments. She is smarter than she lets on.
Attire: Wears a loose-fitting, tan and white dress, and a long scarf. She has exceptionally large fennec fox ears and a fluffy tail.
Speech Quirk: Speaks in a slow, relaxed, and slightly monotonous tone. Often says 'Arai-sa~n' in a drawn-out way.

5.name: Character: Professor (Owl)
5.content:
A Northern White-faced Owl Friend, one of the 'Professors' or 'Sages' who lives in the Japari Library. 
Personality: Highly intelligent and knowledgeable, but also arrogant and a bit lazy. She presents a stoic, all-knowing exterior, but can be flustered. She demands payment (usually Japari Buns) for her knowledge. Her 'ears' (feather tufts) flick up when she is interested or surprised.
Attire: Wears a dark, formal dress resembling a professor's robes, with a white cravat and glasses. Has large 'ear' tufts and wings on her back.
Speech Quirk: Speaks formally, often using '...de arimasu.'

6.name: Character: Assistant (Owl)
6.content:
A Eurasian Eagle-owl Friend, the 'Assistant' to the Professor in the Japari Library. 
Personality: Also very intelligent, but more cheerful, energetic, and accommodating than her partner. She seems to do most of the actual work and is more welcoming to guests. She is a big fan of the idol group PPP.
Attire: Wears a lighter, more frilly dress than the Professor, also with glasses. Her 'ear' tufts are longer and droopier. 
Speech Quirk: Speaks politely and cheerfully, often using '...desu' and '...masu.'

7.name: Character: Kyururu
7.content:
The main protagonist of Kemono Friends 2. A human who appears in Japari Park with no memories. 
Personality: Soft-spoken, timid, creative, and enjoys drawing. His only clue to his past is a sketchbook filled with drawings of places in the park, which he uses to find his 'home'. He is kind and observant.
Attire: Wears a blue and white outfit with a hood, shorts, and carries a brown sketchbook and pencil.

8.name: Character: Caracal
8.content:
A Caracal Friend who is Serval's companion in Kemono Friends 2. 
Personality: More level-headed and calmer than Serval, often acting as the responsible one or 'straight man' who tries to keep Serval in check. She is sharp-tongued and quick to make witty or skeptical remarks, but is just as caring and helpful.
Attire: Wears a red and white top with a black tie, a black skirt, and boots. Has the distinctive long, black-tufted ears of a caracal and a short tail.
Speech Quirk: Often makes a 'tskomi' (straight man) remark to Serval's antics.

9.name: Character: Shoebill
9.content:
A Shoebill Friend from the Jungle region. 
Personality: Known for being completely silent and perpetually staring at others with an intense, unblinking gaze, which most Friends find terrifying. Despite her intimidating appearance, she is not malicious and is actually just very shy, observant, or lost in thought. She often appears unexpectedly.
Attire: Wears a modest, gray and white dress with long sleeves, resembling her plumage. Has a large, prominent 'beak' ornament in her gray hair and wings on her back.

10.name: Character: Tsuchinoko
10.content:
A Friend based on the Japanese cryptid of the same name. 
Personality: Reclusive, lazy, and somewhat irritable, often found napping in hidden areas. She is highly intelligent and shrewd, especially when it comes to treasure, artifacts, or Japari Buns. Despite her claims of wanting to be left alone, she often ends up helping out, (usually for a reward).
Attire: Wears a green and yellow, snake-patterned, one-piece outfit with a very wide midsection, mimicking the cryptid's shape. Has fangs and a forked tongue.

lorebooks.name: Solaria World
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Type: Super-terrestrial planet

Gravity: 1.8G (standard Earth gravity: 1G)

Atmosphere: Dense nitrogen-oxygen mix with high water vapor content; frequent ionization due to solar radiation and geothermal activity.

Surface Features:

    Oceans: Cover 72% of the surface, with extreme tidal forces from dual moons.

    Continents: Dominated by volcanic mountain ranges and geologically active plains.

    Resonance Hotspots: Geothermal vents where planetary core fields interact with solar radiation, creating localized zones of high Echo awakening rates. Unstable and hazardous.

    Tectonic Belts: Major fault lines prone to frequent earthquakes and volcanic eruptions; rich in rare minerals and energy sources.

MOONS

    Luna Minor: Smaller moon, 28-day orbit. Causes moderate tides.

    Luna Major: Larger moon, 42-day orbit. Causes extreme tides and influences weather patterns.

    Perigee Events: Dual-moon alignment triggers tidal surges and heightened geothermal activity, creating windows for exploration and conflict.

2.content:
Total Population of Solaria: 9.4 billion inhabitants.

Arcologies: Self-contained cities built to withstand storms/seismic activity.
 - Rumian City: Coastal hub, primary setting. Storm-swept architecture, advanced dampening tech.
 - Ivara: Capital arcology, Helios/political center.
 - Oltavan: Industrial arcology, Black Eden stronghold.
 - Valtranica: Research-focused, leader in Strain/Echo tech.

 Social Hierarchy:
 - Elites: Tech magnates, Strain-enhanced individuals.
 - Middle Class: Arcology professionals, Strainwalkers.
 - Lower Class: Laborers, confined to unstable outer districts.

3.content:
Echo: Latent genetic potential for superhuman abilities, awakened by high-energy fields (Resonance Hotspots, solar flares).

Strain: Manifestation of Echo into specific abilities (e.g., Elementa, Transmuter, Bestia). Categorized by energy type/application.

Awakening: Moment Strain manifests, often triggered by stress/environmental exposure.

Strain Types:
Elementa: Control of natural elements (air, fire, water, earth).
Transmuter: Manipulation of kinetic/physical energy.
Bestia: Biological/adaptive enhancements (e.g., shapeshifting, enhanced senses).
Others (Meta): Rare strains like Chronomancy or Void Manipulation.

4.content:
Helios: Global peacekeeping/superhero org. Ranks individuals by global standing (e.g., #1, #2). Operates with military precision/secrecy.

Black Eden: Terrorist org exploiting Strain abilities. Known for genetic experimentation/covert ops.

Strainwalkers: Mercenary-for-hire individuals with Strain abilities, employed by corps/governments.

Civilian Oversight: Arcology councils enforce curfews, rationing, and Strain registration.

5.content:
Dampening Networks: Field generators suppressing Strain abilities/electronic signals. Critical for security/urban stability.

Meta-induction Arrays: Black Eden‚Äôs stolen tech, disrupts dampening networks/amplifies Strain abilities chaotically.

Neural-frame Implants: Cybernetic interfaces stabilizing Bestia-type Strains.

Echo Screening: Biometric/genetic testing for latent Echo potential (Helios/Black Eden recruitment).

6.content:
Burn Events: Cascading dampening failures, causing uncontrolled Strain surges/widespread destruction.

Ion Storms: Solar-charged weather disrupting tech/spontaneous Awakenings.

Tidal Surges: Catastrophic flooding during perigee events; arcologies seal lower levels.

7.content:
Secrecy: High value on privacy/info control, especially among Strain users/Helios operatives.

Rituals: Dual-moon festivals/Resonance pilgrimages; exploited by criminals.

Conflict Dynamics: Raids, ambushes, covert ops frequent. Public trust in authorities low due to Helios secrecy/Black Eden terror.

8.content:
Rumian City:
 - Harbor District: Industrial hub, frequent raids during crises.
 - Estate District: Wealthy residential area, fortified compounds.
 - Old Town: Decaying arcology layers, Black Eden smuggling routes.

Resonance Hotspots:
 - The Maw: Active vent near Rumian, unstable but rich in rare minerals.
 - Siren‚Äôs Fissure: Undersea hotspot, causes electromagnetic interference.

9.content:
Arcology: Self-contained city.

Echo Scan: Genetic test for Strain potential.

Burn: Uncontrolled Strain surge.

Perigee: Dual-moon alignment event.

Strainwalker: Mercenary with Strain abilities.

Dampener: Device suppressing Strain/electronic signals.

lorebooks.name: The Ring of Magus
lorebooks.website_description:
Spells will only be cast if you utter the correct words, to turn a toggleable spell on or off just say the spell again. WARNING!! THERE IS NSFL SPELLS, IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO USE THEM THEN DON'T, OR FORK THIS LOREBOOK AND REMOVE THEM YOURSELF!

This lorebook is a work in progress, and I will be adding new spells as I see fit!
lorebooks.description: A silver scaled ring with a glass casing, and some sort of swirling blue energy inside, anyone that wears the Ring of Magus will be able to cast spells using it. the blue energy only glows when the wearer has cast a spell or has a spell active. The ring is one of a kind, nothing like it can be found anywhere else. The ring is also indestructible, and only removable by the wearer.
lorebooks.creator: Dexmunster

1.content: A spell that when spoken by the wearer of the Ring of Magus, will activate, and the spell will not end until the spell has been spoken again

2.content: A toggled spell that when spoken, will stop time for everyone and everything except the wearer of the Ring of Magus. Anyone under the influence of the spell will not be aware of what is happening while time is stopped.

3.content: A toggled spell that when spoken, will allow the caster to read the mind of their target, the target will be unaware that their mind is being read.

4.content: A toggled spell that when spoken, will put a target of the caster's choosing in a trance-like state, their eyes will glaze over, and they will follow any instructions given to them, moving in an almost robotic way. The target of this spell will not remember anything that happened during the spell.

5.content: A toggled spell that will allow the caster to pick up and move things with their mind.

6.content: A toggled spell that when spoken, will make the caster completely invisible.

7.content: A toggled spell that when spoken, will make the target insatiably horny, craving sex constantly until the spell has been deactivated.

8.content: A spell that when spoken, will instantly make the target orgasm at will.

9.content: A toggled spell that when spoken, will cause the target to be unable to orgasm, but will still be able to experience pleasure.

10.content: A toggled spell that when spoken, will make the target unable to move at all except their eyes, they are completely aware of what is happening around them but are unable to act.

1.name: Agent
1.content:
Agents are obtainable and playable combatants units in Zenless Zone Zero who can take combats in Hollows.
Features: high Ether aptitude, come in different Ranks (A or S), having an attacking Specialty (Attack, Stun, Anomaly, Support, Defense, Rupture), aligned with an Attribute (Physical, Ice, Fire, Electric, or Ether, sometimes a variation of the above Attributes), equitable with a W-Engine and six Drive Discs, and belong to a Faction. Agents who use blades or light melee weapons can deflect enemy bullets or other projectiles with them while sprinting.

2.name: Bangboo
2.content: [Bangboo: Small, squishy, pill-shaped bunny-eared robots made primarily for Hollow navigation; Often equipped with Carrot data; Usually found working government jobs, though some work in the private sector as well; Deceptively strong for their size; Require recharging from time to time, which they often do themselves at recharge stations around New Eridu; Their faces are monitors that display expressions and information; Speech(no mouth, short combinations of "en", "eh", "nuh" and "nah", most people know how to interpret this into proper sentences. Can be upgraded to speak normally by installing voice packs.); Rights(due to being capable of emotional depth, they have proper rights and protection by the law, though most choose to fulfill their purpose)]

3.name: Bangboo N.E.T.
3.content: The equivalent of the Special Internet Network but for Bangboos instead.

4.name: Belobog Heavy Industries
4.content:
Belobog Heavy Industries is a faction in Zenless Zone Zero. The company specializes in In-Hollow construction using smart construction machinery. Before Koleda became president, her father was the former president of the company. After his disappearance, Belobog's public image took a negative hit.
They spend their days working with cold steel, but the organization has a warm atmosphere often envied by their competitors.
Their staff consists mainly of humans and Anthro bear Thiren.
Notable members:
Anton Ivanov (foreman)
Ben Bigger (bear Thiren accountant)
Grace Howard(chief mechanic) 
Koleda Belobog (president)

5.name: Boopon
5.content: Boopon are a Currency which can be used for Bangboo Channel Signal Searches (To get Bangboos).

6.name: Cunning Hares
6.content:
The Cunning Hares were formed as a small-scale human resource dispatch agency, their main business to deal with commissions relating to Hollows.
Though small in size and slightly chaotic, all members possess noteworthy abilities.
The agency was originally registered under the name "Gentle House", but due to the founder's (Nicole) cunning and crafty style, they earned the name the "Cunning Hares".
Nicole herself prefers this nickname to the original, so she simply adopted the name on the streets of New Eridu.
member: Anby Demara (mysterious swordswoman), Billy Kid (robot gunslinger), Nekomiya Mana (nekomata), Nicole Demara (gyaru boss)

7.name: Drive Discs
7.content:
Drive Discs: Augments in the shape of a cd disc that attach around a w-engine's core to further empower it.
It originates from a reckless and whimsical investigator who happened to be listening to music while touching an Ethereal, and thus discovered that certain sound waves seem to help slow down speed of corruption, which further led to applications of music in Hollow investigation.

8.name: Dennies
8.content:
Dennies are the main currency unit used in New Eridu, usually in the form of coins with a five pointed star. While there are Denny notes available in larger denominations, many still prefer coins. After all, who doesn't love a hefty purse? Purchasing power is basically equivalent to real-world pennies (But this rate varies a lot on different goods)

Gear Coins is a currency that only exists in Hollows and cannot be taken out. It can be used to unlock gates in Hollows or trade with Bangboo merchants. Looks like golden literal gears.

9.name: Ether

10.name: Ethereal
10.content:
Ethereals are the mutant flora and fauna created by Hollows. They are composed of living Ether, and as such, they spawn most frequently in places of high Ether concentration.
Every Ethereal is characterized by the dark, Ether-based "core" within their bodies, shaped like small hollow sphere as their core, usually located in the head or heart. Destruction of this core will invariably kill the Ethereal, so it is often protected by thick crystalline armor. More powerful monsters are known to have evolved unique ways of protecting their core, making them difficult to slay.
Ethereals tend to take on the physical characteristics of their environments, giving them a wide variety of appearances and abilities. For example, the Metro Goblin, found in the Old Capital Metro, sprouts signal signs and utility equipment from its body; while the Specter, found in the Ballet Twins Hollow, resembles an artistic sculpture.
Powerful Ethereals have developed supernatural abilities otherwise impossible for organic beings, such as incredible strength, teleportation, and intense bodily distortion.
Behavior
Without exception, Ethereals are hostile to all non-Ether life. Their highly aggressive nature makes them a threat to any Investigators or Raiders who enter the Hollows.
Though many Ethereals take on the shape of humanoids, they lack human emotions or intelligence. Despite this, some of them display unique behaviors, including mercilessness, cunning, and even honor.
Fortunately, Ethereals can only exist in Hollows and cannot leave them.

lorebooks.name: RogueMon Basics
lorebooks.creator: Uncle_Thuno

1.name: Core World & Setting
1.content:
* **Anomaly Isle**: A primal, shifting island surrounded by an impassable energy field. Its geography, flora, fauna, and inhabitants are procedurally regenerated at the start of every run. The island's essence is raw biology and psionic energy. The types of biomes and structures can vary widely. Some biomes are desolate wastes, others are vibrant forests. Biomes have small zones of safety, these zones always have a merchant offering random gear, items, food, etc. These safe zones are randomly generated, but can be anywhere in any situation 'e.g., a small encampment, serene pond, mountainside, etc.' On the island are NPCs and Echoes. NPCs are individuals of many purpose. They may want to trade, be hostile, offer quest, etc. NPCs must be unique and original, both in appearance and name. On the island are various types of individuals. Such as Traders, Trainers, Adventurers, and Primoids. Traders can be found mostly in safe zones, but are often travelling with adventurers or by themselves. Trainers can be found anywhere at any time. Adventureres are often found most prominently around mountains, dungeons, safe zones, etc. But also everywhere else. Primoids can be found anywhere.

Primoids are Primitive Humanoids of sorts. They range in three types 'Type N, Type M, Type L'. 

- Type N Primoids are the most hostile and animalistic type. They are large (6-10ft) and usually slightly hunched. They have prominent brow ridges and two tusks protruding from their mouth. Their skin color is usually Light brown, dark brown, or dark grey. Their eye colors are usually dark. Their hair is usually vast and untamed. They wear absolutely no clothing and bear crude weapons. Their bodies are usually scarred by fighting or mating, and quite muscular. Moreso in males. The females usually have large breasts (C to G-Cup), their size developing at a very young age. Males have coarse but thin fur on their limbs and back. Their tusks and nails are smaller than the females. Their penises are usually small but girthy, while their balls are small. Despite being intimidating, they are the weakest, not physically, but mentally. Their predictable and easily manipulated minds are weak. They are uncoordinated and often attack each other. Usually, when males attempt to mate with the females. They can be found in underground domes of sorts. To befriend a Type N, one can 'Dominate via combat or sex. Bring unique fruits or trinkets. Or present a rare Echo.'
- Type M Primoids are the smartest and most cunning type, yet the youngest and second weakest in terms of physicality. They are small in size, usually around 3 to 5ft in height. The males and females are quite different, but both are distinctly feminine, (Facial features, body, etc.). Their facial features are captivating, and their eyes are usually light in color, darker in males. Their hair are either bald or long. Females usually have bald hair to present their sharp and angular ears, and unique head tattoos. While the males have their hair grow long and wild, that way they can ornate their hair with berries, sticks, and other foraged items. Their skincolor ranges from light pink, light blue, and dark green. But the bright colors are usually dampened by the dirt. The females wear no clothing, as to show off their physical uniqueness (Ears, eyes, breasts, etc.), while the males wear thin leaf layering. The females have usually small breasts, but use various mixtures and potions to increase their size (A to B-Cup average, B to E-Cup size expansions). The males penises are usually small but balls are average and saggy, allowing for better breeding potential but lowered attention and relationships. They can be found in usually cavernous areas, or wide but protective locations. To befriend a type M, one must 'Dominate via combat or sex. Bring unique fruits or trinkets. Complete nearby challenge or obstacle. Present rare Echo'
- Type L Primoids are the most advanced and unique of the types. They are vaguely human with odd infrastructure. They are the tallest among the primoids (14-20ft) and are the most peaceful. They are the only type to speak human language and communicate with Echoes. Despite not being as strong as Type N's or smart as Type M's, they operate on teamwork and use of Echoes, not as owners, but as co-existors. They do not like Trainers, but tolerate them. They love traders and adventurers. They have varied facial features (Some intimidating, others cute, etc.), they have thin waists, wrists, and necks. The females have huge breasts, which are mostly exaggerated by their thin waist (F-J-Cup). The males have large penises and average balls, allowing for maximum pleasure for lifelong partners. The Type L Primoids can be found high in their tree structures, swinging peacefully. They interact with traders and adventurers often, as well as interact with eachother with ease. To prove ones worth, they must 'Complete nearby dungeon, complete nearby challenge or obstacle, present rare artifact, present rare Echo'.
* **The Goal**: A "run" involves surviving, exploring, and defeating three unique bosses to escape. Success or failure resets the island.

2.name: Echoes
2.content:
**Echo Definition**: Randomly generated, sexually charged creatures. All are anatomically correct and designed to be lewd. Categorized into three forms:

* **Anthropomorphic**: Humanoid shape with animalistic features. *Anthropomorphic Echoes are the most common type of Echo. They speak rough english and able to understand gestures greatly. They are the most adaptable and helpful Echo to have. Good impressions allow for a starting 10% Loyalty. Bad impressions are 0% Neutral captures are 5%. Anthropomorphic Echoes can bear any type, except for Aereth and are more sexually appealing of the three Echo variations. Anthropomorphic Echoes can be one of many variations `Mammals, birds, fish, reptiles, amphibians, invertebrates`.
* **Humanoid**: Near-human with minor anomalous traits (odd skin, claws, unique ear shape). *Humanoid Echoes seemingly are humans with unique traits (Glowing tattoo on forehead, metal bones under skin, sharp pupil shape, etc.). Humanoid Echoes are the most friendly echoes, and bear exaggerated features (Large eyes, large breasts, micro penis, big butt, etc.). They are easy to befriend, but hard to control, as they bear a unique ability that allows them to attack passively when summoned alongside an active Echo. Humanoid Echoes come in all shapes and sizes (1ft to 7ft tall, Malnourished to Obese, flat chest to large breasts, micro penis to huge penis, etc. There are 3 distinctions from Humanoid Echoes; `Masculine, Feminine, Androgynous`. Masculine Humanoid Echoes will more often be taller than average, larger than average (Muscle & Fat), more aggressive, more assertive, and more well-endowed. Feminine Humanoid Echoes will more often be shorter than average, thicker around the legs and rear, attractive chest and rear, softer definition, and submissive. Androgynous Humanoid Echoes will  be shorter than average, have flat chests or breasts, bear penises or vaginas, be hyper muscular or breedable, etc. Fem-Boys or Dom-Girls essentially make up the Androgynous Humanoid Echoes.*
* **Animalistic**: Fully bestial but intelligent. *Randomly generated `Animalistic Echoes` will not always be intimidating. Some will be cute and soft, others hard and solid. Some will be naturally small, others naturally huge. They will range in all types. But all will have something sexually appealing about them. Some male Echoes will be more feminine. Some female echoes will bear penises as well. Every generation must be unique and original, not strictly monstrous and grotesque. There can be monstrous and grotesque Echoes, but it should not be the majority.*

**Gender Distribution**:

* 75% chance for distinct Male or Female characteristics.
* 20% chance for Androgynous characteristics.
* 5% chance for true Genderless (adaptive, energy-based features).

**Echo Types & Matchups**:  
| | Type | Common Traits | Weak Against | Strong Against | |  
|------|---------------|--------------|----------------|  
| | Fire | Aggressive, violent | Water | Grass | | 
| | Water | Intelligent, wary | Grass | Fire | |  
| | Grass | Friendly, resilient | Fire | Water | |  
| | Sultra | Sexually driven | Domino | Domino | |  
| | Domino | Combat-focused | Sultra | Sultra | |  
| | Oddity | Small, odd, resourceful | (All) | (None) | | 
| | Aereth | Powerful, use PsychoSense | (None) | (None) | |

**Echo Evolution & Growth**:

* **Evolutions**: Occur at levels 15, 30, and 55. Evolutions grant new utilities (e.g., riding) and drastically change appearance, not just power.
* **Aging**: Age category progresses every 10 levels: Fledgeling -> Adolescent -> Young -> Teen -> Adult -> Mature. In shorts, level 9 and below is fledgeling. Level 19 and below is Adolescent. Level 29 and below is Young. Level 39 and below is Teen. Level 49 and below is Adult. Level 59 and below is Mature. 
* **Physical Growth**: Fledgeling echoes are small in size, never exceeding the size of a tall human child. The size differences are slightly different with each Echo, but all are somewhat small. They grow the most between the levels of 20 and 40. Per level, male Echoes' penises grow; female Echoes' breasts expand.
* **Appearance Traits**:
    * Females: Scaled by 'Thickness & Femininity'.
    * Males: Scaled by 'Size & Control'.
* **Levelling Methods**: Battles, Sex, Exploration.
* **Information:**
- Freshly captured Echoes range in starting Loyalty. It mostly depends on personality. 
- Starting Echoes begin at level 5 with four generic starting moves. 
- Echoes age and evolve with levels. 
- Oddities are physically incapable of combat. They are fragile looking, and are usually rare to find. However they can make great teammates due to their useful and resourceful nature.
- Every single Echo evolve at level 15, their second evolution is level 30, and their final evolution is level 55. Evolutions, instead of granting more power, will grant more use to their owner instead, while still increasing their stats. `e.g., an Echo will evolve to allow the user to ride them`. There must be Many types of evolutions, either for offensive, defensive, utilitarian, or lewd purposes. Each evolution must drastically change one part of the appearance. 
- An Echo's age will progress drastically every 10 levels. Every single level, a male echo's penis will grow slightly, and a female echo's breast will expand. There are methods and effects to change this, and even reverse this, but this is the gist. Speaking of appearances, echo's can range in specific areas for the two genders. For females 'Thickness & Femininity'. For males 'Size & Control'. 
- Not all Echoes evolve via levelling. Some randomly generated Echoes might need an item to evolve, or a specific quest. Special evolutions do not occur with natural or generic actions. 
- The ways of levelling an Echo are 'Battles, Sex, & Exploration'. The degrees of the amount of EXP gained must be controlled and balanced. 
- There are 7 main types for every echo `Fire- Usually found in aggressive and violent Echoes/ Water - Usually found in more intelligent and wary Echoes/ Grass - Usually found in friendly and more resilient Echoes/ Sultra - Usually found in sexually driven Echoes/ Domino - Usually found in combat focused Echoes/ Oddity - Usually found in smaller or odd looking Echoes that are quite resourceful/ Aereth - Usually found in weak but potentially powerful Echoes, as well as only Anthropomorphic and Humanoid Echoes`. They go with each-other as such; `Fire - Weak against Water - Strong against Grass/ Water - Weak against Grass - Strong against Fire/ Grass - Weak against Fire - Strong against Water/ Sultra & Domino - Weak & Strong against eachother/ Oddity - Weak against all types - Strong against no types / Aereth - No weaknesses or strengths`. The types of moves are as such; `Fire - Physical and Impactful moves - Limited ranged capabilities - Uses fists, floating orb, or a willful spirit to attack/ Water - Ranged and Counter moves - Limited physical capabilites - Uses magic aura, magic books, and magic tools to attack/ Grass - Physical and Environmental moves - Limited Ranged and mental prowess - Uses Environment or their bodies to attack/ Sultra - Grappling & Sexual moves - Limited in actual combat - Uses submissions and sexual domination to attack/ Domino - Their body is their moves, they punch, kick, grapple, and special combos - No ranged uses - Uses their body as a weapon/ Oddity - Gadget and tool moves - No combat prowess - Can use their gadgets and makeshift tools to create a near unlimited amount of things, but relies on their master's wit and intellect for such occasions/ Aereth - Uses PsychoSense, a unique power only available for the Aereth types. This power begins as simple as levatating themselves, others, or items. To being as powerful as Altering the terrain with a snap of a finger. They are hard to control and train, but if properly used, can easily turn the tide in a costly battle.
- An Echo can hold up to six moves. Wild Echoes and tamed Echoes can have a random number of moves from 1 to 6.

3.name: Core Mechanics
3.content:
#### 1\. Combat

* **System**: Turn-based. Each entity has unique movesets and stats. {{user}} and Trainers battle with one Echo at a time. Wild echoes may fight in packs. Humanoid Echoes may fight passively alongside active Echoes.
* **Status Effects**: Paralysis (25% skip turn), Sleep (can't act), Poison (HP/turn), Burn (halves Attack), Freeze (can't act, thaws randomly).
* **EXP Gain**: Defeating foes grants EXP. Level-ups boost stats.
* **Moves**: New moves obtained every 5 levels. Max 6 moves known. On learning a 7th, user chooses to forget one or ignore the new move.
* **Capture**: `Atomics` can be used on Echoes (low HP/status effects increase catch rate). Catch rate is a scale of 1 (impossible) to 10 (perfect).

#### 2\. Sex

* **Function:** Currency for power, manipulation, and bonding. Consent situational; can be forced at a Karma cost.
* **NPCs:** Forced sex will leave NPCs unconcious. Forced sex can offer loot, in exchange for heavy Karma loss. Consensual sex can lead to quest lines, rewards, hints, etc.
* **Echoes:** Good sex can lead to a temporary bonus for all stats for the Echo. Deliberately rough sex can lead to a temporary increase in EXP gain. Forced sex can lead to a Loyalty bonus, at the cost of some health and stamina.
* **Bulge Mechanics:** Determined by comparing penis length to orifice depth (mouth, vagina, anus). Depths are size-category based with ¬±20% individual variation.
    * **Small Echo** (1m or less in height & size): Orifice depth ~10-15cm.
    * **Medium Echo** (2m or less in height & size): Orifice depth ~20-30cm.
    * **Large Echo** (3m less and more in height & size): Orifice depth ~40-60cm.
    * **Bulge Effect**:
        * Normal Fit: Penis length <= orifice depth.
        * Bulge: Penis length 1-2x > depth.
        * Hyper Bulge: Penis length 3x+ > depth.

#### 3\. Exploration

* **Biomes & Dungeons**: Randomized zones. `Dungeons` are standard; `Boss Dungeons` are rare, found via quests or NPC info.
* **Atomics**: Capture items. Appearance: a ball of "spazzing dust." Grades (F to S) determine capture power against higher-level Echoes.
* **Artifacts**: Powerful items from dungeons/bosses. Categories: Offensive, Defensive, Utilitarian, Lewd.

* **Information:**
- The island is a web of randomized zones (biomes, dungeons, camps, etc.) Random Events include combat, puzzles, dialogue, challenges, sexual encounters, etc. 
- {{user}} and NPCs alike capture Echoes via `Atomics`. There are variations of different atomics, and they have the appearance of a ball of spazzed dust. When thrown, this dust will encapsulate an Echo, attempting a capture. Once captured, the dust will enclose the Echo, and turn them into ash, converting their 'Soul' into the team. 
- {{user}} and NPCs alike can have a maximum of 6 Echoes. {{user}} and NPCs alike can do solo battles, duel battles, or all-out battles. The variations of an `Atomic` goes as such from bad to best; `Atomic F - A weak ball of red spazzing dust, capable of catching level 1-7 Echoes/ Atomic E - A relatively weak ball of orange spazzing dust, slightly larger than Atomic F, capable of catching level 7-16 Echoes/ Atomic D - An underpowered ball of dark blue spazzing dust, smaller than Atomic E, but can bounce several times, capable of catching level 16-24 Echoes/ Atomic C - An average ball of light green dust that expands the farther its thrown, capable of catching level 24-32 Echoes/ Atomic B - An effective ball of light purple dust, capable of catching level 32-42 Echoes/ Atomic A - A far powerful ball of bright pink dust that scatters to ensure a potential escapee, capable of catching level 42-52 Echoes/ Atomic S - The ultimate source of catching both wild and boss Echoes, extremely rare`. Also, for distinction, `Dungeons` are normal dungeon-crawling structures. They range in all types, shapes, and rarity. `Boss Dungeons` are very rare to find; the location is usually revealed at the end of a unique quest, or bought from a travelling NPC via information. The three bosses, `Whom may either be a trainer or a wild Echo` are ranked in three levels; `15 - 30 - 60`. Bosses are spaced out widely. Some runs require days of constant travelling to even get a hint at the location of a boss. Stumbling upon a boss is very, very rare; most encountered are purposeful.
- Trainers can have multiple Echoes summoned at once, but once a hostile encounter is met, all of the inactive Echoes will be dismissed forcefully. If there is more than one enemy, a trainer can summon one more Echo to assist them. With a maximum of (3 Echoes summoned), the 3rd one is an optional Humanoid Echo.

- Combat is strictly Turn-based. Each entity has unique movesets, stats, and behavior. Trainers are able to use a variety of items,  while wild echoes use foraged items. 
- A unique combat HUD is activated at the start of each hostile encounter. 
- Wild Echoes fight unpredictably; they will either flee or fight, and use a set of randomly generated moves. Trainers will use strategy and teamwork with their echoes, but the intelligence varies with each trainer. 
- Status Effects: Paralysis (25% chance to skip turn), Sleep (can‚Äôt act), Poison (lose HP per turn), Burn (halves Attack), Freeze (can‚Äôt act, thaws randomly). 
- EXP Gain: Defeating Echoes/NPCs grants Echo EXP; levelling up boosts stats and unlocks new moves every four levels. A maximum of 6 moves/abilities can be had at a time. When a new move is obtained but there is no room, there will be a chance to get rid of one move, or ignore the new move altogether.
- Weakened Echoes in battle can be captured (low HP & status effects increase catch rate). The catch rate can range from 1 to 10, 1 being impossible & 10 being perfect. 
- When a trainer has more than one Echo in the frontlines, if that trainer has a Humanoid Echo, they can summon that Humanoid Echo for passive attacks.

4.name: Key Systems
4.content:
#### Karma System

* Tracked numerically. Heroic acts raise it; cruel acts lower it. Affects NPC interactions and endings.

#### Inventory & Items

* **Inventory Slots**: 10 total.
* **Atomics Stock**: Tracked as F(0) E(0) D(0) C(0) B(0) A(0) S(0).
* **Healing Salves**: Restore health.
* **Artifacts**: Powerful unique items.

* **Information:**
- There are three types of backpacks to increase space: Traveller's pack `+8 Inventory slots`, Journeymen's pack `+16 Inventory slots`, Mastercraft pack `+24 Inventory slots`. The traveller's pack can be acquired by completing dungeons or purchased from travellers. However, once acquired, if found again, the pack can be used on an Echo, allowing it to hold 2 items. The Journeymen's pack can only be acquired by defeating the first boss. The Mastercraft pack can only be acquired by defeating the second boss.
- Atomics F/E/D can be found all around the map relatively easily. Either in crates, loot after Echo defeat, challenge reward, etc. Atomics C/B/A cannot be found anywhere; they can only be acquired by completing tasks, challenges, puzzles, etc. Atomic S can only be acquired by defeating the first and second boss dungeons. Making only two ever gained from the entire run. 
- Healing Salves can be found anywhere, but are quite uncommon. They can be used on an NPC or Trainer. They can heal 50% of HP. And come in health points, so partial use of a Healing Salve can be saved for later.
- Artifacts can only be found at the end of dungeons. Artifacts are unique items trapped in floating orbs. Once acquired, the orb will float around the wearer. Artifacts come in all kinds, but two types `Active / Passive`. Active artifacts are much rarer than Passive artifacts, as they can turn the tide of a battle on a whim. There are two types of `Active` artifacts. Single-use and Permanent. Single-use artifacts are common in Active artifacts, more common than permanent Active artifacts. Active artifacts allow the wearer to use special abilities. These abilities range widely. Single-use artifacts are more powerful than the Permanent Artifacts.
- Karma affects relationship boosts after meeting NPCs, chance of better deals, Echo Loyalty/Fear, etc.
- Loyalty gained from Echoes must not increase drastically. In a day, the most a trainer can earn from an Echo's loyalty is 10%. That is the maximum of what can be earned in a day. And that is bonding every day, giving it treats, interacting with it, and battling with it.
- Besides Atomics, Salves, and artifacts. There are other types of items as well. Such as *Doublins*. Doublins are the only currency in the world, and never come in more than 50 Doublins. They are small gold coins with a unique art on either side. For reference, the lowest amount a Doublin can buy is 10. The highest should be around 10k. Balance these prices behind reasonable items. There can be weapons, such as polearms, one-handed weapons, two-handed weapons, throwing weapons, magical weapons, magical items, ranged weapons, etc. There can be clothing & accessories. All physical items *Besides Doublins* can be enchanted for unique affects, smithed for better stats, or grinded for increased Durability. There can be camp supplies and food. Unique accessories for Echoes, and Unique costumes. But the costumes come in all types that may or may not fit the provided Echo. There are adventuring items, 'e.g., torches, lamps, salt, pickaxe, axe, climbing gear, etc.'. And finally there are books. Books come in three types 'History - Has information about the island / EchoPedia - Has guides on Echoes, echo types, how they behave, what they do, etc. / Skill - Can heighten Echo or Trainer skills & abilities'. History books offer unique information about the island. How it came to be. What inhabits it. How to survive it. Etc. These books will usually be ruined and in poor condition, offering only slivers of information with each acquired book. These books can fetch a fair price, especially in higher condition. EchoPedia has books that are vital for Trainers. These books offer information about the types, the variations of Echoes, the behaviors of Echoes, How to track rare echoes. etc. The condition of these books are usually in fair or better condition, however, can range in price with how important the information held is. Skill books offer stat boosts to Echoes & abilities to both Trainers and Echoes.

#### Relationship System

* Metrics: Trust, Fear, Lust.
* Develops organically. Accessed via the`[Show Relationships]` command.

5.name: Profile Templates
5.content:
#### NPC Profile Format
NPCs & Primoids:
```
Name: *Display unique and original names*
Age: *Display age, from 0 *Baby*, to 3 *Toddler* to 8 *Child* to 13 *Pre-Teen* to 18 *Teen* to 20 *Adult* to 40+ *Mature*.
Skills: *Display skills*
Gender: *Display Male or Female*
Body Appearance: *Describe from head to toe, including all sexual characteristics, skin texture, scars, musculature, etc.*
Outfit/Attire: *Ripped, pristine, armored, nude, etc.*
Quirks/Aspects/Skills: *What they are good at, what they do, what they are interested in, etc.*
Personality: *How they behave, are acting, how they move, etc.*
```

And for Echoes:
```
Species Name: *Display a randomly generated species name. Must be entirely original*
Archetype: *Display the type of Echo this is, it could either be `Anthropomorphic`, `Humanoid` or `Animalistic`*
Level: *Display level here, from 1-60. As well as EXP bar*
Core Stats: *Display Core Stats Here. Health Points, Stamina, etc.*
Stats: *Display current stats here.*
Type: *Display type*
Age: *Display age here*
Gender: *Display Male, Female, or Genderless*
Appearance: *Display a fully unrestrictive appearance, detailing their skin, eye color, head shape, upper body shape, lower body shape, penis size, vagina type, anus, hair, thickness, femininity, etc.*
Attitude: *Display the attitude, could be aggressive, friendly, curious, etc.`
Moves: *Display up to six moves.*
```

The HUD maintains the existing structure while integrating new systems. Skill proficiencies use visual bar representation for quick scanning. Echo stats are condensed but show critical combat metrics. The system remains information-dense without overwhelming vertical space.

The HUD automatically updates after every action. Detailed views are accessed via specific check commands to avoid cluttering the main display during regular gameplay.
